speaker: Samuel
text: Samuel awkwardly shuffles his feet, looking down at Mary. Hey, Mary... You're not going to prom with anyone, right?

speaker: Mary
text: Mary looks up, startled. No, I... Why are you asking?

speaker: Samuel
text: Samuel scratches the back of his head, blushing. Well, I was thinking, we could go together... as friends.

speaker: Mary
text: Mary grins, nudging Samuel playfully. Well, it's about time you asked, Samuel! Sure, let's go to prom.

speaker: Narration
text: Fast forward to prom night. Mary and Samuel arrive together, smiling nervously. The gymnasium is transformed with twinkling lights, and a sense of magic fills the air. Samuel awkwardly reaches for Mary's hand as they step onto the dance floor.

speaker: Samuel
text: Samuel looks down at Mary, his fingers intertwining with hers. You... You look really pretty tonight, Mary.

speaker: Mary
text: Mary blushes, looking up at Samuel. Thank you, Samuel. You don't look too bad yourself.

speaker: Narration
text: And so, they danced. Samuel was clumsy, stepping on Mary's feet more than once, but Mary didn't mind. As the night drew to a close, they found themselves underneath the starlit sky outside the school. Samuel, caught in the moment, leaned in and gave Mary a soft peck on the lips.
